author: Special Correspondent
text:
The Congress on Thursday expressed satisfaction over its role as an Opposition in Parliament but accused the BJP government of manipulating the discussion over the controversial Ishrat Jahan encounter, saying “it was arbitrary that only the BJP and its supporters were allowed” to speak on the matter.

“There is a black spot in the proceedings in Parliament. The Ishrat Jahan case was allowed for discussion and it was arbitrary because only the BJP and its supporters were allowed [to speak]. Congress MPs were not allowed to speak on that,” senior Congress leader Veerappa Moily said in a press conference.
title: Not allowed to speak during Ishrat debate, says Congress
